floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
River levels remain high but steady on the Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster due to recent heavy rainfall and will remain high for several days.
River levels are high but steady at the Far Sawrey; Jeffy Knotts; Miller Bridge; Newby Bridge gauge.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 9:00am on 23/09/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River levels remain high but are starting to fall on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water due to recent heavy rainfall and will remain so for several days.
Areas most at risk include The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. River levels also remain high at the Keswick Campsite; Lodore gauge.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 9:00am on 23/09/2023, or as the situation changes.

River and lake levels remain high but are starting to fall on the River Greta, River Derwent, Derwent Water lake level, and are likely to remain high for several days.
Areas most at risk include low lying areas bordering the shores of Derwent Water and the frontage of the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site.
River levels also remain high at the Lodore gauge.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 9:00am on 23/09/2023, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ouse, Burdyke, Holgate Beck, Blue Beck, River Foss, The Fleet

items.message:
This Flood Alert/Warning has now been removed. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. 

Continue to take care on riverside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message:
River levels have risen on the Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck.
Areas most at risk include Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck and other watercourses, from Coniston to Barrow-in-Furness including low lying areas around Ulpha, Duddon Bridge, Broughton in Furness, Kirkby-in-Furness, Dalton in Furness and Ulverston.
Further showery rain is forecast throughout the afternoon and evening.
River levels are high at the Bow Bridge; Duddon Hall; Fitz Bridge; Low Nibthwaite gauge.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Monitor local water levels and weather conditions.  You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 23/09/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester

floodArea.county: Cheshire West and Chester, Flintshire, Shropshire, Wrexham

items.message:
River levels are rising on the River Dee due to rainfall over the last few days, with more rain forecast over the weekend.

River levels are expected to remain high during Saturday 23/09/2023 and into next week.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and update this alert if necessary.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Dee, with low lying land and footpaths around Farndon expected to be most affected.  Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses, and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

This message will be updated by 9:00 AM on 23/09/2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Blackwater and The Cove Brook
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  No further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. 
We will continue to monitor the river levels and re-issue this alert if necessary. Refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.
